text:
I live by the Golden Rule: “Treat others as you wish to be treated.”

During #BullyingPreventionMonth, it’s especially important to remember to be kind to one another as we work to build a better future for young Americans across the country. carper.senate.gov/newsroom/n…

From my days as Governor working with @MikePurzycki on our shared vision for Wilmington’s Riverfront, to his work to lead the city we both call home, I am proud of Mike’s dedication to Wilmington. I wish him the best of luck as we both “run through the tape” these next 15 months.

DYK: It’s #MentalHealthAwarenessWeek. This is a good time to remind anyone in need that there are critical, confidential, & free resources available to those struggling with mental health challenges. The @988Lifeline is one resource, and it’s saving lives all across the country.
This #HispanicHeritageMonth, we honor the tremendous achievements of the Hispanic community in the First State and across the country.

Best of luck to the @Phillies as they begin their playoff run tonight! 

#RingTheBell
Welcome to our newest colleague, Senator Laphonza Butler! I look forward to working together to help working families on the East Coast, West Coast, and everywhere in between.

It was great sitting down with @USAID Administrator Samantha Power today to discuss how we can best work with our partners to promote democracy across the globe. It’s clear that America’s place in the international community is made more secure by @PowerUSAID’s leadership.

Important news: You can now order four free COVID-19 rapid tests directly to your home!

Visit covid.gov/tests to order yours, & keep your family safe and healthy this season.

It was great to see #DelawareVeteransStandDown spreading the word about veterans’ resources recently.

As the last Vietnam veteran in the U.S. Senate, I’m proud to lead on key legislation that helps our service members return to civilian life. wmdt.com/2023/09/stand-down-…

Happy #4HWeek! 🍀

For more than a century, @4H has empowered generations of Delawareans and young Americans across the country. It’s been wonderful to see so many young people engaged in community service through this program.

Happy birthday, President Carter! 🎂

A man of vision and integrity, President Carter has long appealed to our better angels. Our nation is better off because of his leadership and work with the @CarterCenter.

From one Navy man to another: Bravo Zulu!

I’m extremely disappointed that this bill did not include necessary funding for our ally Ukraine. Congress - and the Biden Administration - must find other ways to avoid interruption of the aid to the Ukrainian people. 

My full statement: carper.senate.gov/newsroom/p…
This is only a band aid, as this temporary funding will only last until November 17th. We must come together, Democrats and Republicans, to fund the government with a long-term solution.

The Senate voted today to avert a government shutdown, which could have been disastrous for our country and its people. I’m relieved Congressional Republicans came to their senses to avoid an unnecessary, reckless, and entirely manufactured shutdown that could have been avoided.

I had the honor of serving with John McCain in the U.S. Congress for more than 20 years. I’m glad to see @POTUS take this step to memorialize him as the patriot and defender of democracy that all of my colleagues knew him to be. cnbc.com/2023/09/28/biden-to…

A government shutdown would force our brave men and women in uniform to report for duty without pay.

That’s not just bad for our military families – that’s bad for our national security. We must come together to reach a deal that funds our government and keeps Americans safe.
Martha and I are saddened to hear of the passing of Senator Dianne Feinstein. Read my full statement below:

Great news! Thanks to the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, Delaware is receiving $2,919,819 from @ENERGY to boost our electrical grid’s reliability and resilience in the face of climate change.

This will help keep the lights on during future storms and support good-paying jobs.

At today’s @SenateFinance hearing, I was glad to hear from IRS Chief Counsel nominee Marjorie A. Rollinson on how she plans to support the agency’s workforce and promote strong customer service for taxpayers seeking assistance. carper.senate.gov/newsroom/p…

I spoke on the Senate floor to advocate for the swift confirmation of Robert Taub and Thomas G. Day to serve on the Postal Regulatory Commission. Both nominees have extensive careers in public service and would be key to the work of the Commission. carper.senate.gov/newsroom/p…

It was great stopping by @DelmarvaBlood’s Blood Drive in the U.S. Capitol today! 

As a regular donor myself I know this small act can make a big difference. If you can, please consider becoming a donor and help save countless lives throughout our communities.

Student parents work hard every day – not only to build a better life for themselves, but also to pave the path to success for their children. I’m proud to work with @JerryMoran in designating September as National Student Parent Month. carper.senate.gov/newsroom/p…

With the Farm Bill set to expire at the end of this month, it’s important we come together to find solutions. 

Recently, I sat down with farmers from across Delaware to discuss how we can work together to ensure our state remains an agricultural leader.
capegazette.com/article/sen-…

Americans pay into #Medicare throughout their lives expecting to retire in dignity.

Protecting the health of this program is a sacred promise to seniors across the country.

I have long worked to make it a priority across the federal government to root out billions of dollars in waste, fraud & abuse. I’m proud to introduce the Safeguarding the Transparency and Efficiency of Payments (STEP) Act to continue this critical work. carper.senate.gov/newsroom/p…

This year, the U.S. has already experienced 23 separate climate disasters each costing more than $1 billion — the most ever!

Thanks to the Inflation Reduction Act, we're doing more than ever before to tackle the climate crisis. Still, we must do more.
nytimes.com/2023/09/21/clima…

🗓️ Mark your calendars: The PACT Act created a one-year special enrollment window for post-9/11 combat veterans who are not currently enrolled in VA health care – but the deadline for this special enrollment is September 30, 2023. 

Enroll now by visiting VA.gov/PACT!
The @KalmarNyckel Foundation is celebrating 25 years of connecting Delawareans to our rich cultural heritage! I was proud to join the celebration — here’s to 25 more!
I stopped by @IndianRiverDE Southern Delaware School of the Arts to #ThankAnArtsTeacher today. The arts inspire, heal and connect us, and I’m proud to support the arts in DE!  @KenCen
Martha and I wish an easy and meaningful fast to those observing Yom Kippur in Delaware and across the country.

DYK: It’s #TelehealthWeek! Telehealth is a lifeline for millions of Americans. 

I like to say, bipartisan solutions are lasting solutions and I’m proud to have worked with @JohnCornyn to expand telehealth options for children through the Bipartisan Safer Communities Act.

Happy #NationalPublicLandsDay! Delaware’s natural beauty is truly unmatched and I was especially proud to help establish our state’s first national park a decade ago this year. It’s always a good idea to get outside and enjoy our public lands!

This is excellent news and a step in the right direction. We have a moral obligation to address our nation’s epidemic of gun violence, and @POTUS is leading the way to build a safer future for all Americans. cbsnews.com/news/white-house…
Big things are happening in Milton! I joined @GreaterMiltonDE today to visit businesses and see the town’s plans for the future.

If you’re a veteran in need of assistance or have questions about benefits, come to Schutte Park in Dover today where representatives from over 100 veterans organizations are available to help until 2 pm! #DelawareVeteransStandDown

What’s cooler than these shades?

Phasing down the use of super-polluting HFCs under the Kigali Amendment and AIM Act.

This is helping us avoid 0.5 degrees Celsius in global warming and supporting American companies manufacturing the next generation of these refrigerants. 😎🌎🙌

The Inflation Reduction Act is making a real difference in the way we do business. Now some small businesses are getting help to lower their energy costs thanks to this historic legislation.   capegazette.com/article/dela…

Factoring the true costs of carbon pollution into federal decision-making will help save taxpayer money and lead to investments that are better for the future of our planet. Bravo Zulu @POTUS!
nytimes.com/2023/09/21/clima…

At a @HSGAC nomination hearing today, I heard from nominees for the Postal Regulatory Commission and the District of Columbia Superior Court. These are critical roles that merit swift action by the Senate. carper.senate.gov/newsroom/p…

It was an honor to hear from President @ZelenskyyUa on the importance of continuing our strong support for Ukraine. We must do everything in our power to protect democracy and support Ukraine’s fight against Russia during this unprovoked and unjustified attack.

Happy birthday, @AmeriCorps! 🥳

In the 30 years since President Clinton started AmeriCorps, over a million Americans have given back to their communities. It has been a delight to see this volunteer spirit take hold up and down Delaware and across our country. #AmeriCorps30

It was great speaking with so many @IntFreshProduce advocates from Delaware last week! The First State is an agricultural hub, and we discussed ways to ensure that Americans across the country have access to healthy and nutritious food.

The future looks a bit brighter today!

Bravo Zulu to the Biden-Harris administration for providing opportunities to thousands of young Americans to help grow our nation’s clean energy economy.

I had a great time recently speaking with Tamara Smith, Executive Director of @TeachForAmerica in Delaware! The next generation is in good hands with leaders like Tamara working to improve education up and down the First State.
It was great to speak with @ACSCAN advocates today! Cancer claims far too many lives, and I’m glad to speak with Delawareans leading the charge to secure cancer research funding.

At today’s @SenateFinance Subcommittee on Health hearing, I highlighted the importance of meeting people where they are to address their health care needs, like Medicare’s Hospital at Home program. We must make this a permanent program for patients. carper.senate.gov/newsroom/p…

Today is #NationalVoterRegistrationDay! 

Every American deserves to have their voice heard in our democracy, so take a few minutes to register or check your registration status — and then encourage a loved one to do the same!
It was wonderful having advocates from @SourceAmerica stop by my office last week! We had a great conversation about how we can make employment opportunities more accessible for disabled Americans.
L’Shana Tova, Delaware! Martha and I wish a prosperous new year to all celebrating Rosh Hashanah.

Our country is facing a childcare crisis. Today, I joined @RepLBR at @DelawareTech Stanton Campus to break ground on the American Rescue Plan-funded Child Development Center to help tackle this problem in Delaware.
I am honored to join our volunteer firefighters in Wilmington for the DVFA Convention, and I’m proud to support the Fire Grants and Safety Act in the Senate to help protect our firefighters.

Hardworking families across the country pay their taxes fair and square, and the wealthy should, too. The Inflation Reduction Act is making sure of that.
apnews.com/article/irs-milli…

Today is National POW/MIA Recognition Day. As the last remaining Vietnam veteran in the U.S. Senate, I've witnessed the sacrifice so many military families have made for our country. We must do all we can to ensure prisoners of war and those missing in action are never forgotten.
Thanks to the Trade Alliance for Health for hosting a conversation about this crucial legislation today.

The COVID-19 pandemic taught us many lessons about our nation’s medical supply chains – but even now, 140+ medications are considered in short supply by @US_FDA. That’s why I introduced the Medical Supply Chain Resiliency Act to help mitigate these issues.

The government must be able to respond to and utilize new AI technologies. At today’s @HSGAC hearing, I discussed AI’s ability to improve the efficiency and function of federal agencies, and the need to examine its effect on our workforce. carper.senate.gov/newsroom/p…

At today’s @SenateFinance hearing, I highlighted the need to establish closer economic ties with Taiwan. It’s clear that eliminating double taxation will spur job creation in the U.S. and Taiwan, a win-win for both nations. carper.senate.gov/newsroom/p…

NEWS: Thanks to the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, Delaware is receiving $531,690 from @EPA to improve our recycling infrastructure and waste management systems.

These investments will help protect our environment while creating jobs and promoting economic growth!

It was great having the Spooky AC 47 Gunship Brothers in the Capitol last week. This organization works to support Vietnam veterans, and it was great speaking with Air Force veteran and lifelong Delawarean Vaughn Morgan, and his wife Dale.

From one recovering governor to another, it’s been great working alongside @SenatorRomney. There’s still plenty of work to get done, and I look forward to continuing our bipartisan work to deliver for the people of Delaware and Utah.

As a veteran of the Vietnam War, I have long worked to strengthen diplomatic ties with Vietnam. I was glad to see @POTUS travel there this week to continue our efforts to establish productive American-Vietnamese relations.
themessenger.com/politics/vi…

Today we celebrate 29 years since the Violence Against Women Act was signed into law, an important milestone towards achieving equality in this country. I’ve always been proud to reauthorize #VAWA because it’s critical we continue to protect women and safeguard women’s rights.

There has been much progress in U.S.-Vietnamese relations since my first visit as a Member of Congress in 1991. U.S. affirmation to the Comprehensive Strategic Partnership with Vietnam will continue to bolster ties, strengthen regional security, & improve economic cooperation.

Congratulations to Tanya Bradsher, the first woman ever confirmed to serve as @DeptVetAffairs’ second highest official. As a veteran herself, she is uniquely qualified to serve in this role. This is a win for veterans, caregivers, and families.

DYK: The U.S. added more than 187,000 new jobs in the month of August alone.

For anyone who hasn’t gotten the memo: #Bidenomics means record job growth.

Stories like this are an excellent reminder that the future is in good hands. Bravo Zulu to @delcastle_ths students for developing two EV charging stations at their school.
delawareonline.com/story/new…
Today we remember the thousands of lives lost in the horrific 9/11 attacks, as well as the families and first responders who were forever changed in its aftermath.
Happy birthday to my wingman in the Senate, @ChrisCoons! It’s always an honor delivering for Delawareans alongside such a dedicated public servant.

It was my pleasure to speak to the @LeadershipDel class of 2023 today. Every single one of you is working to make Delaware a better place to live, work and enjoy, and I think our state’s future looks bright!

ICYMI: Last week, @USDOT announced $23M in federal funds that will go toward building the Newport River Trail. This is an exciting investment that will bring Delawareans together to appreciate our state’s unmatched natural beauty. delawarebusinesstimes.com/ne…
Medicare’s ability to negotiate prescription drug prices is a big deal. It’s clearer than ever that the Inflation Reduction Act is working for working families.

At today’s @HSGAC hearing, I heard from @PostalRegulator nominee Robert Taub, as well as three nominees for the District of Columbia Superior Court. I look forward to seeing these well-qualified individuals swiftly confirmed by the Senate. carper.senate.gov/newsroom/p…

Another reminder that we must do more — not less — to tackle the climate crisis 🥵
washingtonpost.com/weather/2…

At a @HSGAC Subcommittee hearing yesterday with members of @DHSgov, I made it clear that we must ensure border patrol agents have the resources they need to effectively manage migrants arriving at our southwest border. carper.senate.gov/newsroom/p…

September is National Preparedness Month. As climate change continues to fuel more frequent and damaging disasters, it is critical for communities to have the necessary supplies and emergency preparedness plans in place when disasters strike. carper.senate.gov/newsroom/n…

I applaud @POTUS and @SecDebHaaland for canceling these remaining oil and gas leases in the Arctic Refuge. Protecting this land, water, and wildlife will help preserve the way of life for the nearby Indigenous people and benefit our planet for generations to come.

Delaware farmers are making improvements to their business that help our environment through @NRCS_DE programs. 

Thanks to Jonathan Walton and Chris Breeding for showing me how they are putting these programs to work on their Sussex County farms.

In reflecting on my August travel, I learned a lot about what’s on the minds of Delawareans and Kenyans. It was eye-opening to see some similarities in the work ahead for both the U.S. and Kenya, and I look forward to advancing our shared priorities. delawareonline.com/story/opi…

Congratulations to Capt. Taylor on this incredible honor. As the last remaining Vietnam veteran in the United States Senate, it brings me great joy to know that Capt. Taylor’s story of service and sacrifice will be remembered for generations to come. cbsnews.com/news/biden-award…

Farmers are often on the front lines of clean energy – and that’s true of Nicole and Ken Wilkins of Felton, DE!

It was great visiting their Funny Farm to see how adopting clean energy practices are providing them economic AND environmental benefits. wmdt.com/2023/08/u-s-sen-tom…

Today I was proud to announce new funding for @Brandywine_BCCS’s new Mobile Medical Unit. This on-the-go, compassionate approach to health care will serve at least 300 people suffering from addiction in the next year and help close health care disparities all across Delaware.
Happy first day of school, Delaware! I wish you a successful start to this new academic year and I’m excited to see your bright futures ahead.

Happy Labor Day, Delaware!

I often say that Delaware punches above its weight. That’s thanks to a first-class workforce across our state who tirelessly provide for themselves and their families — as well as unions who make sure our people get a fair shake in the workplace.

It was great having @JReckford in Wilmington this week to show him the impactful work that @Habitat_org is having across our state! I’m proud to work with organizations like Habitat for Humanity to increase access to affordable housing.

Heads up, Delaware: the application for Encouraging Development, Growth & Expansion (EDGE) Grants opens up TODAY! This is an opportunity for qualified small businesses to access grant funding through a competitive selection process.

Learn more at de.gov/edge!

.@FoodBankofDE provides more than just nutritious food to those in need — it has programs to uplift our community members, too. Now with its Milford expansion, thanks in part to the American Rescue Plan, the Food Bank will have an impact on Delawareans for generations to come.

Did you know oysters help filter our water and stabilize our shoreline? 🌊🦪

It was great to be part of an important discussion today on how we can support Delaware's growing oyster aquaculture industry.
wmdt.com/2023/08/sen-carper-…

Today is International Overdose Awareness Day, a time to remember the millions of lives lost to overdose and honor those whose lives have been forever changed. This crisis has afflicted our communities for far too long and we must work together to put an end to it.

Thanks in part to the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, Delaware is receiving $14.9 million to improve wildlife habitat and enhance resiliency throughout the Delaware River Watershed.

Investments to protect our environment support local communities and keep our state beautiful!

It was great seeing the future of space right here in Delaware last week! The students at @UDelaware’s Space Observation Center are ready to take us to infinity and beyond. 🚀
delawarepublic.org/science-h…

Small businesses across Delaware are serving their communities, like Marins Med in Georgetown. On a recent visit, I saw firsthand how they are helping veterans through their innovative approach to prosthetic development. 
baytobaynews.com/stories/pro…

Every once in a while I like to surprise constituents who write to me. I met Bill Mosely of Hartly, who is in the day program at @EasterSealsDEMD, and with their help, wrote a letter on health care & transportation issues for those with disabilities. He’s an inspiration to all.

Health care decisions should be between the patient and their doctor. As #HealthCareAwarenessMonth comes to a close, I’m proud to stand up for reproductive rights and women’s health care all across our country.

If you’ve visited the Joseph R. Biden Train Station in Wilmington recently, you’ve probably noticed a few new upgrades in the works!

Thanks to the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, we're investing in the infrastructure that keeps our economy moving forward.

The Biden administration has consistently sought to provide regulatory certainty and protect our nation’s wetlands and waterways — and has continued to do so by working quickly to amend its WOTUS rule within the confines of the troubling Sackett ruling.
news.bloomberglaw.com/enviro…

When it comes to slashing health care costs, Bidenomics is changing the game for working families all across the country by:

🚫Cracking down on junk insurance
👉Preventing surprise medical billing
⚕️Lowering prescription drug costs

That’s #Bidenomics in action.

Today’s announcement is proof that the Inflation Reduction Act is working. No one should have to decide between putting food on their table and paying for prescriptions, and I was proud to lead several provisions of this life-changing legislation.
washingtonpost.com/health/20…

When negotiating the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law's transportation investments, sustainability and equity were top of mind.

Thanks to our work, @NCCDE is receiving a $23 million RAISE grant from @USDOT to construct a 2-mile, shared-use path along the Christina River. 🙌

Thank you to our Delaware farmers who met with me this week to discuss the issues facing the ag industry.

As we work to pass the next Farm Bill, local input is critical to DE’s economy.

Sixty years ago today, more than a quarter of a million people gathered on the National Mall to participate in the March on Washington. This was a rallying call for justice that reverberated all across our country and led to transformative action in the fight for civil rights.
Congratulations to Wilmington VA Medical Center’s new director, Vamsee Potluri. I’m excited to work with you on delivering top quality health care for our veterans!

With funding from the American Rescue Plan, we are taking an important first step in tackling the housing crisis across Delaware. I’m glad to see @MilfordDE using these funds to build a shelter village for homeless residents. baytobaynews.com/stories/mil…

USDA Rural Development is investing in Delaware! At the Wilkins’ farm in Felton, @usdaRD helped install solar panels to save electricity costs. For the Jones’ family in Camden, USDA Rural Development helped them realize their dream of homeownership.

ICYMI: Last week, we celebrated the one-year anniversary of the Inflation Reduction Act. I was proud to help lead several historic climate and health care provisions in this bill, and it continues to deliver for Americans across the country.
I’m proud to help deliver American Rescue Plan funding that will support renovations and new housing at the Home of the Brave, which supports our homeless veterans get back on their feet.

Who else is looking forward to reducing single-use plastic litter in the First State?
 
Polystyrene (aka Styrofoam) food containers too often end up polluting our communities, harming our health and environment. This is the right thing to do!
delawareonline.com/story/new…

Last stop: @UDelaware’s Climate Hub! 

It was wonderful to speak with students about their research to combat climate change. I am confident that our future is in good hands! #GoBlueHens

Then I had lunch with @UDelaware President Dennis Assanis and @NIMBL Director Dr. Kelvin Lee. At the Grain Exchange on @UDelaware’s STAR Campus, we had a great conversation about ongoing campus research and how we can continue to work together to  facilitate innovation.

Next, I toured @UDelaware’s College of Agriculture and Natural Resources, and got to see the newly-renovated lab in Worrilow Hall. I also spoke with Dean Calvin Wheeler about how we can continue to work together to tackle important agricultural issues facing our state.

Much of the research being done at @UDelaware is out of this world – literally! 🌎

My first stop was with Dr. Bennett Maruca, who leads the Delaware Space Observation Center along with @DelStateUniv. This new center will enhance space research and education across our state.

As a proud @UDelaware alum, it was great to be back on campus today! I had the chance to learn about several projects made possible through federal investments, and which highlight how UD is leading our state into the future. Follow along! 👇

In the First State, we saw first hand how @SBA_Delaware and @DSBDC help businesses thrive. Today I stopped by Strive PT, Marins Med, and Lord’s Landscaping to learn how federal programs are helping grow their business.
Thanks, @TheStateNews, for the great conversation about everything happening in Dover, our state and beyond!

August is National Minority Donor Awareness Month! More than half of the patients on the national transplant waitlist are from communities of color. By working together to increase diversity in donations, we can save and heal more lives.

I toured the new @ChristianaCare Pediatric Unit in Newark today where medical staff provide emergency and behavioral care in a way that is tailored just for children. This is a fantastic model that we are working to replicate at community hospitals across the country!

The Inflation Reduction Act provides @EPA with unprecedented resources to make @POTUS’ climate goals a reality. These investments are also providing a much-needed boost to American manufacturing, helping create clean energy jobs across our nation.

Let’s get it done!

American Rescue Plan funds are addressing cellular coverage gaps up and down Delaware. I’m proud to have fought for this law to make the First State more connected than ever. delawarepublic.org/science-h…
August is National Black Business Month! Delaware is home to so many Black-owned businesses, and we must continue to support and empower working families across the country.

On this day 103 years ago, the 19th Amendment was ratified guaranteeing women’s suffrage. This was a momentous occasion in our nation’s history, proving that the right to vote underpins so many of the other rights and freedoms we enjoy in this country.

The Inflation Reduction Act is changing the game for taxpayers all across the country. With more staff to process returns and answer taxpayer inquiries, the IRS is now better equipped to help Americans throughout the filing process. nytimes.com/2023/08/16/us/po…
Medicare is an important lifeline for millions of Americans. I’m glad to be part of #HealthcareAwarenessMonth and continue our important work to protect and increase access to this vital program.

ICYMI: Last week, I participated in a Q&A with @LCVoters to celebrate the 58th anniversary of the Voting Rights Act and reflect on the work that remains. Read more on what I think we should do to protect and expand voting rights nationwide.  👇 lcv.org/blog/protecting-the-…

As Governor, I worked to support student mental health by putting a nurse in every public school in Delaware. I applaud these actions today to strengthen mental health services in and out of school. wrde.com/news/legislation-to…

Happy birthday to the Inflation Reduction Act! 🎂

In one year, the IRA has helped lower costs, create jobs, and drive historic investments in clean energy and climate action. And we’re just getting started.

Commercial air travel from @FlyILG is growing in Delaware with access to new destinations! As airlines like @AveloAir expand their service, travelers have more options and Delaware’s economy continues to grow – a true win-win for the First State!
delawareonline.com/story/mon…

Social Security is a sacred promise to our seniors – and on this day in 1935, President Roosevelt signed the Social Security Act into law. We must continue to protect this vital program that helps millions of our loved ones and neighbors live out their golden years.
I sure love my EV! Thanks to the Inflation Reduction Act, they are becoming more affordable than ever before.

Throwback!

Throughout my career, one of my favorite places to meet Delawareans one-on-one has always been bowling alleys! Today, on #NationalBowlingDay, I’m thinking about the great conversations I’ve had at bowling alleys across Delaware.

As a regular blood donor, I know this simple act can go a long way. I’m glad to see the @RedCross lift their ban on so many LGBTQ+ donors, because no one’s identity should keep them from giving back to their community. cnbc.com/2023/08/07/red-cros…
These critical investments that I fought for in the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law are going to help install EV chargers up and down the First State!  delawarepublic.org/science-h…

Martha and I are praying for those who have lost their loved ones, homes, and livelihoods in these devastating fires — a stark reminder of what is at stake on a warming planet. We must provide immediate relief to these communities and work to prevent future disasters like this.

Big news: @HUDgov recently announced that Wilmington will receive a $50M grant to expand equitable, accessible, and affordable housing in the First State. This is a historic opportunity to make real change.

I’m glad to see @DeptVetAffairs extend this deadline so that more of our veterans can qualify for backdated benefits under the #PACTAct. Be sure to file your claim–or submit your intent to file–at VA.gov/PACT by Monday, August 14 in order to be eligible for benefits.

The power sector generates roughly a quarter of U.S. greenhouse gas emissions.

That’s why I'm leading the call for EPA to implement stronger carbon pollution standards that reduce emissions from power plants.
It’s been one year since @POTUS signed The CHIPS and Science Act into law, and the results already speak for themselves.

Delaware leads the nation as the best state to retire. As more seniors look to retire in our state, we need programs like the one @HUDgov, @HabitatNCC, @HabitatKent, & @SussexCountyHFH are providing to help low-income seniors live out their golden years.
wmdt.com/2023/08/delaware-ha…

We can't have a healthy democracy without a liveable planet.

Last year, I helped pass the Inflation Reduction Act—the single-largest climate change investment in our nation’s history. Now, I'm working with the Biden admin. to realize the benefits of this unprecedented law.

States are laboratories of democracy, but democracy depends on equal access to the ballot. By passing the Freedom to Vote Act & the John Lewis Voting Rights Act, Congress can fulfill our responsibility to protect the right to vote and uphold the sanctity of our electoral process.

One of the first times I came to D.C., I attended the hearings that led to the passage of the Voting Rights Act. I’ve seen firsthand how the VRA became a transformative piece of legislation, ensuring every American has a right to vote regardless of the state they call home.

The Voting Rights Act of 1965 was a monumental step towards #DemocracyForAll, but in the years since we’ve seen continued attacks on voting rights and protections.

I’m joining @LCVoters for a Twitter Q&A to discuss how I’m working to protect the freedom to vote. Follow along.👇

🚨 Heads up, Delaware veterans: there are only two days left to apply for backdated PACT Act benefits. 

Be sure to visit Va.gov/PACTAct for more details on how you can apply.

DYK: August is National Immunization Awareness Month! 

Take it from me: staying up-to-date on your shots is an easy way to keep you, your loved ones, and your community members safe from countless communicable diseases.

As climate change continues to fuel more intense hurricane seasons, it’s critical for families and businesses to have emergency preparedness plans. That’s why I recently joined @FEMA_Deanne to tour Sussex County’s emergency operations center. coastalpoint.com/news/carper…

The American Rescue Plan continues to serve communities all across the country. I was proud to secure nearly $6 million for housing initiatives in every corner of our state. baytobaynews.com/stories/del…

Every Delawarean deserves to live in safe housing. 

That’s why @HUDgov, @HabitatNCC, @HabitatKent, and @SussexCountyHFH are launching a home modification program for low-income seniors. Contact your local Habitat to see if you’re eligible!

Happy birthday, @BarackObama! 

I’ve always admired your tenacity, good humor, and impeccable ability to get the job done. Our country is much better off because of your leadership in the White House, and it’s wonderful to see your important work continue at the @ObamaFoundation.
I look forward to working with Director Santos to ensure the public availability of data from the 2020 Census. Read my full letter here. 👇 carper.senate.gov/newsroom/p…

The @USCensusBureau plays an important role in providing policymakers with critical information. Today, I sent a letter to @CensusDirector Santos to express my concern about delays in the release of data from the 2020 Census.

I couldn't be more pleased with #WRDA2022 and the good the law is doing for Delaware.

The investments we make now in our water resources are investments in a better, safer future.
#WRDA2022 is also helping to advance world-class coastal research at @UDelaware. 🔬 🥼

At the mouth of the Murderkill River, #WRDA2022 is making it easier to place and maintain emergency signage.

This single action will make boat operators better aware of hazardous conditions and bolster public safety.

For disadvantaged communities in Delaware, #WRDA2022 enables @USACEHQ to:
 
💧 Create a workforce & STEM outreach program
💧 Reduce required local contributions on shoreline protection projects
💧 Establish a Tribal and Disadvantaged Communities Advisory Committee

#WRDA2022 also greatly reduces Delaware's vulnerability to the impacts of climate change by:
 
🌊 Enhancing resilience of shore protection projects
🌊 Lowering project costs in disadvantaged communities
🌊 Creating an emergency authority for @USACEHQ to address storm damages
Along the Indian River Inlet, #WRDA2022 helps safeguard Delaware’s infrastructure and keep communities connected.

For the first time since 2007, #WRDA2022 authorizes environmental infrastructure programs across the nation, including $35 million for each of Delaware's counties. 
 
These programs allow @USACEHQ to repair drinking water systems, wastewater systems, and stormwater management.

This month, I've had the privilege to visit communities around Delaware and discuss the Water Resources Development Act of 2022.
